p: Ethanol (95%) and n-Hexane (95%) were obtained from Echo Chemical (Miao Li, Taiwan) and Tedia (Fairfield, OH), respectively. The chemicals as follows were purchased from Sigma–Aldrich (St. Louis, MO): glucose standard, amylose standard (from potato), protease (EC 3.4.23.18), amyloglucosidase (EC 3.2.1.3), α-amylase (EC 3.2.1.1), and sodium bisulfate. Fresh L. aromatica was obtained from a Vietnamese store in Taipei, Taiwan. After removal of the roots, the plants are washed. Subsequently, the leaves and stems were freeze-dried for 2 days. The dried sample was grounded and sieved using the 60-mesh sieve. The fat in the powder was then extracted using n-hexane as the solvent. The solid residue was collected and dried. The dried residue (defatted L. aromatica - DFLA) was extracted using ethanol (6 h) to remove phenolic compounds. After phenolic extraction, the residue obtained (hereafter referred to as DFPLA) was air-dried and stored at 4 °C for further analyses.
